Title: May I throw away waste here?
Kanji: アンナ:　お母さん、　ここ　に　ゴミ　を　捨てて　も　いい　です　か
寮母: そうねえ。　缶 は　別　の　袋　に　入れて　ください。資源ですから
アンナ:　はい。分かりました
Kana: アンナ:　おかあさん、　ここ　に　ゴミ　を　すてて　も　いい　です　か
りょうぼ: そうねえ。　かん は　べつ　の　ふくろ　に　いれて　ください。しげん　です　から
アンナ:　はい。わかりました
Romaji: Anna: Okāsan, koko ni gomi o sutete mo ii desu ka
Ryōbo: Sōnē. Kan wa betsu no fukuro ni irete kudasai. Shigen desu kara
English: Anna: Mother, May I thhow away waste here?
Dorm Mother: Well, Please put the cans in a different bag. Because they are recyclable resources
Vocabulary: - お母さん (おかあさん - Okāsan) = Mother, mother dormitory
- 捨てて (すてて - Sutete) = Te form of verb 捨てます(すてます - Sutemasu) = Throw away
- 入れて (いれて - Irete) = Te form of verb いれます (Iremasu) = To put in
- 資源 (しげん - Shigen) = Recycle resources
- から (Kara) = In this case indicates  a reason
Description: Te form verbs + も　いい　です (mo ii desu)
If these 2 forms are together, it means that a permissions to do the action is granted:
- たべて　も　いい　です(Tabete mo ii desu) = It´s ok for you to eat or You are allowed to eat
To ask for permission, add か(Ka) at the end. For example ask if it's ok to eat cookies:
- たべて　も　いい　です　か(Tabete mo ii desu ka) = May I eat?
If the other person gives you permission it will say どうぞ(Douzo) = Please go ahead
